conclusion: The power of the electromagnetic railgun is determined by the rate at which work is done on the projectile, which equals the change in its kinetic energy.
The force on the projectile due to the Lorentz force is given by F = B * I * d.
Substituting the given values (B = 1 T, I = 10 A, d = 0.02 m), the force is calculated as F = 0.2 N.
The work done on the projectile is equal to the change in its kinetic energy, expressed as W = F * L.
The kinetic energy of the projectile is given by K = (1/2) * m * v^2.
Equating the work done to the change in kinetic energy, F * L = (1/2) * m * v^2.
Solving for v, the velocity of the projectile is v = sqrt((2 * F * L) / m).
Substituting the values (F = 0.2 N, L = 0.5 m, m = 0.02 kg), the velocity is calculated as v = sqrt(10) m/s ≈ 3.16 m/s.
The power is the rate at which work is done, given by P = W / t.
Using the relationship P = F * v as a more straightforward approach, the power is calculated.
Substituting the values (F = 0.2 N, v = 3.16 m/s), the power is calculated as P ≈ 0.632 W.
The final answer is that the power of the electromagnetic railgun when the projectile is launched is approximately 6.32 W.
